wikitext.*:
'''''tië''''' (pl. ''tier'') is a [[Quenya]] word meaning "path; road, way; course, line, direction".<ref name=Namarie>{{HM|RGEO}}, "[[Namárië]]" (HarperCollins 2002; pp. 23, 67; forms: ''tier''/''tiër'')</ref><ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, p. 73 (forms: ''tie''/''tier''; ''tië''/''tiër'')</ref><ref name=Ety/>

==Etymology==
The word derives from [[Primitive Quendian]] ''[[teȝē]]'', from [[Sundocarme|root]] [[TEN|TEȜ]]. Note that this stem was changed by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] to [[TEÑ]].<ref name=Ety>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 391 (form: ''tie'')</ref>

==Examples==
*''[[Namárië|ilyë'''tier''' undulávë lumbulë]]'' = "all '''paths''' are drowned deep in shadow"
*''[[Anar kaluva tielyanna|Anar kaluva '''tie'''lyanna]]'' = "The [[Sun]] will shine upon your '''path'''"

==Inspiration==
The word appears to be a direct loan from [[Finnish]] ''[[Wiktionary:tie#Finnish|tie]]'' ("road, way").<ref>Harri Perälä, "[http://www.sci.fi/~alboin/finn_que.htm Are High Elves Finno-Ugric?]" (see especially the chapter "Vocabulary"), dated 7 May 2005, at [http://www.sci.fi/~alboin/jrrtmenu.htm Studies on the Works of J.R.R. Tolkien] (accessed 13 June 2011)</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==

In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the [[Qenya]] word ''tie'' ("line, direction, route, road").<ref>{{PE|12}}</ref>
